group: Coastal Zone Management and Marine Conservation
name: Temporal variability in coastal geomorphology
Description: Understand the variability of coastal morphology through time
featuresOfInterest: Coast, sand movement, rocks, channels, banks
timeSensitiveRequirements: Before and after large storms. Alternatively, routine monitoring (e.g. monthly).
tidalInfrastructureRequirements: If using a base station network/ satellite PPK positioning, GPS tides are a worthy option, especially if ellipsoid outputs are what is desired. Tides are necessary to quantify change.

group: Coastal Zone Management and Marine Conservation
name: Mapping sediment compartments
Description: Mapping bathymetry and backscatter for mapping entire sedimentary compartment and seafloor types, or species preference for the habitat.
featuresOfInterest: Geomorphology and the extent and distribution of sediment types and size. For reef (reef morphology, feature size and relief) and for soft-sediment (the sediment facies).
additionalRequirements: Resolution requirements for deep waters is 25-50m. The requirements for horizontal and depth accuracy for deep waters are 10m.

group: Coastal Zone Management and Marine Conservation
name: Modelling change in the surf zone and nearshore
Description: Test and improve numerical modelling of storms impacts at the coastline.
timeSensitiveRequirements: Immediately pre and post large storm events
tidalInfrastructureRequirements: If using a base station network/ satellite PPK positioning, GPS tides are a worthy option, especially if ellipsoid outputs are what is desired. Tides are necessary to quantify change.

name: Scallop mapping
Description: Identify and model preferred seabed habitats of Saucer Scallop
featuresOfInterest: Sediment distributions and geomorphology, seabed type

name: Fisheries mapping
Description: Map the distribution of habitat types across fisheries
featuresOfInterest: Seagrass, macroalgae, sponges, reefs

name: Geologically-based habitat mapping to establish baseline data
Description: Establish baseline data to identify seafloor characteristics. This also involves integration with other discipline data (sedimentology, hydrodynamic, geochem, ecology, SBP)
featuresOfInterest: Variation in seabed characteristics (Slope, Rugosity, Hardness, etc) and structure
environmentalConditions: Collect data when the sea conditions are good and there are no storms.

name: Geologically-based habitat mapping to monitor changes
Description: Monitor changes in the seafloor characteristics, which involves integration with other discipline data (sedimentology, hydrodynamic, geochem, ecology, SBP)
featuresOfInterest: Variation in seabed characteristics (Slope, Rugosity, Hardness, etc) and structure
groundTruthingMethodOther: NON DESTRUCTIVE TECHNIQUES SUCH AS TOWED VIDEO. Benthic grabs for sedimentology.
environmentalConditions: Prior to and after disturbance or routinely. Exclusion zones (whales protection areas)
tidalInfrastructureRequirements: If using a base station network/ satellite PPK positioning, GPS tides are a worthy option, especially if ellipsoid outputs are what is desired. Tides are necessary to quantify change.

name: Reef systems mapping
Description: Habitat mapping targeting reef systems (reef identification using bathymetry and backscatter)
featuresOfInterest: Rocky reefs extent and the amount of cover on reefs
tidalInfrastructureRequirements: If using a base station network/ satellite PPK positioning, GPS tides are a worthy option, especially if ellipsoid outputs are what is desired. Tides are necessary to quantify change.

deliverables.name: Map of reef extent and coverage

name: Hydrodynamic modelling
Description: Creating a bathymetric model (inland and offshore waterbodies) for input into hydrodynamic modelling software
featuresOfInterest: Channels, sand bars, reefs
environmentalConditions: When the sea is not to rough.

name: Hydrographic charting
Description: Upgrade existing or make new charts
featuresOfInterest: Features that may pose a danger to surface navigation and cause vessels to run aground (as defined in IHO s44)
environmentalConditions: Whenever the sea is not too rough

name: Port depth declaration
Description: Hydrographic Survey specific to port depth declaration
requirements: Ensure the data is delivered in the local chart datum according to the requirements of the user. Delivery must be in local chart datum.
featuresOfInterest: Any features which may affect under keel clearance
timeSensitiveRequirements: Data to be collected during daylight hours
tidalInfrastructureRequirements: Tide gauges in the port minimum 30 days observations
approvalPermitRequirements: Port autorities, environmental authorities, fisheries, state marine parks
objectDetectionRequirements: Any objects bigger than 1 cubic meter

name: Port safety analysis and risk assessment
Description: Generate risk assessment profile in support of port safety work, including dredge works, erosion mapping or engineering design
requirements: Survey reports and charts to be delivered
featuresOfInterest: Obstructions
frequencyRange: 400kHz with Low frequency in deeper waters (200, 30, 15KHz)
timeSensitiveRequirements: Data to be collected during the day
swathWidth: 3 to 5 times of the water depth
lineSpacing: Changes with water depth. Line spacing = Swath Width ~= 3 x Water Depth
tidalInfrastructureRequirements: Cotidal charts or tidal observation for calculating LAT
approvalPermitRequirements: Port Autorities, Environmental Authorities, Fisheries, State Marine Parks

name: Local hydrographic charting
Description: Survey approach channels to corner Inlet (utilise by offshore oil and gas industry vessels)
featuresOfInterest: Those features that pose a hazard to navigation

name: Mapping local marinas
Description: Hydrographic survey of local marina

name: Dredging support and maintenance
Description: Support dredging activities, including monitor channel depth (e.g. shoals) and port under keel clearances from dredging works.
requirements: Ensure the data is delivered in local Chart Datum and according to the requirements of the user.
featuresOfInterest: Shoals, debris, and any feature that pose a danger to navigation.
frequencyRange: For MBES: 100kHz and 400 kHz. For SBP, 4-15 kHz.
tidalInfrastructureRequirements: Tide gauges in the port minimum 30 days observations or during the whole period of operations whichever greater
approvalPermitRequirements: Port autorities, environmental authorities, fisheries, state marine parks

name: Port maintenance
Description: Survey bathymetry pre-dredging, dredging, and post-dredging of ports.
featuresOfInterest: Any feature that is above the declared depth of the channel, berth, or harbour.

name: Pipeline surveys
Description: Map pipeline and surrounding seafloor together with side scan to monitor pipeline condition and seafloor stability.
featuresOfInterest: Pipes, spans scour damage
timeSensitiveRequirements: Before specific dates, usually annual surveys. Not winter.

group: Natural Disaster Recovery and Hazard Mitigation
name: Mapping coastal hazards
Description: Model coastal hazard, e.g. coastal erosion, inundation, etc.
featuresOfInterest: Extent of sand/reef, bathymetry, sediment compartments.
tidalInfrastructureRequirements: If using a base station network/ satellite PPK positioning, GPS tides are a worthy option, especially if ellipsoid outputs are what is desired. Tides are necessary to quantify change.

group: Natural Disaster Recovery and Hazard Mitigation
name: Mapping submarine fault systems
Description: Map major transform fault boundary where magnitude 7 to 8 earthquakes are common and tsunamis can be expected.
featuresOfInterest: Faults, canyons, sedimentary bedforms, underwater volcanos.

name: Site survey for oil and gas infrastructure development
Description: Site survey for a oil and gas field.
featuresOfInterest: Large features that would make placing subsea assets difficult

name: Mapping hydrocarbon seeps
Description: Identify the location of seeps and choosing core sites.
requirements: The requirements for bathymetry and backscatter resolution are respectively 15m and 5m. The horizontal accuracy should be < 3 HDOP. The vertical accuracy should be within 1% of the water depth.
featuresOfInterest: Faults, mounds, pockmarks, tectonic features, authigenic carbonate outcrops, chemosynthetic clam beds, nodule beds, rock outcrops, brine pools, salt domes, mineral deposits.
timeSensitiveRequirements: Depends on the region.  Good weather time preferrably
deliveryRequirements: GIS project (.mxd and all geodatabases and interpretations) should be delivered as part of the final delivery. Furthermore, sds of all water column anomalies and interpretations. Alongside .sgy data, provide Kingdom suite project files as well.

group: Geological mapping and seafloor physical characterisation
name: Geoscience research
Description: Generate bathymetry and backscatter to identify seafloor features
featuresOfInterest: Canyons, landslides and drowned reefs, beforms.

group: Geological mapping and seafloor physical characterisation
name: Mapping canyons and subsurface features
Description: Map canyons and sub surface features to understand tectonics, exposure of seafloor rock samples, or natural sub surface seepage indicators.
featuresOfInterest: Pock marks, faults exposed at sea floor, or hard grounds.

group: Geological mapping and seafloor physical characterisation
name: Mapping offshore geological surfaces
Description: Map the bedrock geology (and seabed substrate)
featuresOfInterest: Bedrock

group: Geological mapping and seafloor physical characterisation
name: Mapping sediment grain-size
Description: Generate sediment maps derived from backscatter data.
featuresOfInterest: Sediments, sand

group: Geological mapping and seafloor physical characterisation
name: Mapping seafloor types i.e. substrates
Description: Map the spatial distribution of seafloor types or species preference for the habitat.
requirements: The resolution requirements for deep waters are between 25 to 50m.
featuresOfInterest: Geomorphology

name: Mapping extended continental shelf
Description: Delineate the outer continental shelf of countries and identify Foot of Slope (FOS) points for their Extended Continental Shelf (ECS).
requirements: The requirement for the resolution may vary with water depth. Similarly, the vertical accuracy should be 0.01% of water depth.
featuresOfInterest: Foot of slope, 2500m isobath
timeSensitiveRequirements: Depends on location; Arctic in late summer, Atlantic need to avoid hurricane season.

name: Ground truthing of backscatter data
Description: Collect seabed samples to groundthruth backscatter data and predict seafloor type. This application may involve identification of sediment compartments and video ground  truthing.
requirements: If DGPS is used for positioning, then a horizontal accuracy of 0.5m is needed. If RTK is used, horizontal accuracy should be 50mm or less. Vertical accuracy requirement for deep water and nearshore/estuaries are respectively 0.3m and 0.1m
featuresOfInterest: Reef and marine sediment extent and location.

name: Reference surfaces for airborne LiDAR bathymetry
Description: Use of MBES for serving as 'ground truth' for a subsequent Airborne LiDAR Bathymetry survey.
timeSensitiveRequirements: Ideally before ALB data acquisition starts, usually a couple of weeks turnaround.

name: Reference surfaces for bathymetry sensor
Description: Use of MBES for serving as 'ground truth' for a subsequent bathymetric survey using any sonar sensor.
featuresOfInterest: Stable sea floor
timeSensitiveRequirements: Data remains current for a maximum of 1-3 months, hence every 1-3 months.
